We are excited to announce that our 2020 graduation ceremonies will be Friday, May 22, 2020 at 8:00 p.m. at Mustang Stadium. We will abide by the graduation guidance provided by the Texas Education Agency and local government agencies. Therefore, each graduate will be provided 8 tickets for the event and we will have assigned seating for each family throughout the stadium. In addition, each attendee must answer a series of health-related questions (provided by the state) before entering the stadium. Graduates will be receiving additional detailed information from DCHS Principal Rick Martinez. Thank you for your patience while we work out the details of this milestone event and for your support of what we are able to plan for your graduates in these uncertain days. Congratulations to the DCHS Class of 2020! We wish you the very best as you leave us to make your mark in the world. “Be Wisdom. Be Love. Be Courage.” BeDC!
Gary Davis, DCISD Superintendent

Gary Davis

🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸
On this day... 18 years ago 246 people went to sleep in preparation for their morning flights. 2,606 people went to sleep in preparation for work in the morning tomorrow. 343 firefighters went to sleep in preparation for their morning shift. 60 police officers went to sleep in preparation for morning patrol. 8 paramedics went to sleep in preparation for the morning shift of saving lives. None of them saw past 10:00am Sept 11, 2001. In one single moment life may never be the same. As you live and enjoy the breaths you take today and tonight before you go to sleep in preparation for your life tomorrow, kiss the ones you love, snuggle a little tighter, and never take one second of your life for granted.

DENVER CITY ISD EXTENDS PAY RAISES

Denver City teachers, nurses and counselors can expect a $2,000 pay increase for the upcoming school year, which equates to an increase of between 3% and 5% per step.

The DCISD Board of Trustees voted to award the pay increase, despite the fact that the local district is not required to do so according to the new guidelines of the Texas Legislature.

Funds allocated by the state for pay raises are based upon total revenue increases per Average Daily Attendance (ADA). Due to a decline in local ADA, DCISD saw no increase in revenue, which resulted in no additional state funding to the district for the required pay raises.

Board members voted to reward the hard work and dedication of district employees. In addition to the pay increase for teachers, nurses and counselors, the board is seeking ways to award increases to the other employees of the district, as well.

On behalf of DCISD, our staff students and school board, we thank you all for helping make DCISD safer and more secure. Today was a great day to BeDC!

DCHS graduate makes his mark in the NFL

2007 DCHS graduate, Brittan Golden is making his mark on the NFL with the Arizona Cardinals. After graduating from Denver City High School, he played for the West Texas A & M Buffaloes. He was originally signed by the Chicago Bears and spent time with the Jacksonville Jaguars. He was signed to the Arizona Cardinals practice squad in September 2013. Later the same season Golden was promoted to the 53 man roster. He caught his first career touchdown on a 9-yard pass from quarterback, Carson Palmer. He played in 12 games with one start in 2016, recording eight receptions for 82 yards and one touchdown. Brittan is the son of Phillip and Pennye Golden. Congratulations to Brittan for his tenacity, his hard work and his success. Brittan Golden...way to BeDC!

“If you have a crisis, there are heroes who rise above it.” – Jerry Bruckheimer
This quote exemplifies the DCISD family and the Denver City community who stepped up to the challenge today and made the safety of our students their number one priority! You are all HEROES in my book. You were selfless in your actions and you all pulled together to protect and defend our kids. Thank you for your efforts, your willingness to help, your patience, your understanding and your professionalism. Thank you to the staff, students and parents of DCISD; to our first responders and law enforcement for the way you handled today’s crisis situation. Thank you for springing into action so quickly and for pulling together as a team. Thank you to the First Baptist Church for offering your building as a safe haven for our JH evacuation and student release. If wisdom, love and courage were ever displayed by a group of people, today was the day. Denver City witnessed the action of many heroes today. As always, it's a great day to BeDC!
